recipe.recipe_name: Spinach and Mushroom Egg White Omelette
recipe.ingredients: - egg whites: 6 - fresh spinach: 2 cups - mushrooms (sliced): 1 cup - onion (diced): 1/2 cup - low-fat feta cheese: 1/4 cup - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Vegetables: Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add diced onions and sliced mushrooms, and saut√© until they are soft and the onions are translucent. 2. Add Spinach: Add the fresh spinach to the skillet and cook until it wilts, usually about 1-2 minutes. 3. Cook Egg Whites: In another non-stick skillet, pour in egg whites seasoned with salt and black pepper. Cook over medium heat until the edges start to lift from the pan. 4. Fill Omelette: Once the egg whites are mostly set, spoon the spinach, mushroom, and onion mixture over one half of the omelette. Sprinkle with low-fat feta cheese. 5. Fold and Serve: Carefully fold the other half of the egg whites over the filled side. Let it cook for another minute, then slide onto a plate and serve.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 12g, Dietary Fiber: 3g, Sodium: 550mg, Saturated Fat: 2g, Total Fat: 8g, Protein: 28g, Cholesterol: 10mg, Total Sugars: 6g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 290 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Egg Whites: 102 calories for 6 egg whites Fresh Spinach: 14 calories for 2 cups Mushrooms: 15 calories for 1 cup Onion: 32 calories for 1/2 cup Low-fat Feta Cheese: 80 calories for 1/4 cup Olive Oil: 119 calories per tablespoon Salt, Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 1
